overview:
Leonard Chung is President and CEO of Syncplicity, an online data management provider. Leonard has been working in the technology industry for over sixteen years with a particular emphasis on successfully developing and delivering version one products and ideas. He has a broad set of skills and experiences including program management, user community management, consulting, software development and testing.

Previously, Leonard was a Program Manager at Microsoft and one of twenty hires selected for the companyâ€™s high potential training and development program. He has been working in the area of data management and internet scale applications for over eight years. Notable past projects include SETI@home, Windows PowerShell, and internet storage company Scale Eight. Notable past collaborators include RISC/RAID inventor David Patterson and ACM Turing Award Winner Jim Gray.

Leonard received a B.A. in Computer Science and a B.A. in Cognitive Science from the University of California, Berkeley.
